page.title: 18FARMING SAMPLE STUDIES
page.content: cont. from page 17. farm.The farm is still owned by Ackworth School.The farm-house is not the original one and the new one was altered from a cottage in 1979.The walls of the farm-house are made of local sandstone and the roof is made of flagstone.The buildings near the farm are a garage,tractor shed,corn store,feed mill house,dairy,milking parlour,cubicle house,silage barn,2 Dutch barns and cattle yard.Most of the farm buildings are the same age as the farm-house but have been modernised.The milking parlour is called a Herring Bone Parlour because of the way the cows stand while being milked. The total acreage of the farmland is 250 acres.This is divided into 16 acres of barley,50 acres of oil seed rape,16 acres of kale and the rest is
